body_html:
Just an update. I just ran my script on an OS X host with 32 GB RAM and tensorflow version. It ran successfully!
One thing I notice is there was no message stating like I had on my Centos 7 host:
2018-10-10 11:57:23.827653: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/process_util.cc:69] Creating new thread pool with default inter op setting: 2. Tune using inter_op_parallelism_threads for best performance.
Why does it segmentation fault on my host running Centos 7?

body:
Just an update. I just ran my script on an OS X host with 32 GB RAM and tensorflow version. It ran successfully!
 One thing I notice is there was no message stating like I had on my Centos 7 host:
`2018-10-10 11:57:23.827653: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/process_util.cc:69] Creating new thread pool with default inter op setting: 2. Tune using inter_op_parallelism_threads for best performance.`
Why does it segmentation fault on my host running Centos 7?
